page.title: 19Kimbolton - Recreation
page.content: Two well-maintained playgrounds serve the younger children.Brownies,Guides, Scouts and Youth Club are available for the next age-group.For adults there is a wide range of activities.The{Town}Football and Cricket Clubs (the prefix a proud relic of past status)are traditionally strong,and the latter draws members from a wide radius.Badminton,Swimming and Tennis all have a good following.There are smaller,but long -standing societies for amateur drama,local history,bell-ringing, choir,photography,rifle-shooting. Women's Institute,British Legion,Darby and Joan meet regularly.There are about 20 diligent allotment-holders. Many of the over-18's who indulge in these activities will subsequently join those less energetically minded in one of Kimbolton's 5 pubs.
